$schema: Session state schema for session skill

_status_notes.draft: Spec in progress, not yet complete
_status_notes.finalized: Spec complete, ready for plan phase
_status_notes.finalized_complete: Spec complete, no plan needed - session done (exploration revealed no changes required)

high_level: Provide visibility into session workflows across managed projects
mid_level: Project management - onboard codebases, track status
Session swimlane - visualize sessions progressing through SPEC/PLAN/BUILD/DOCS
Phase drill-down - view rendered spec, plan, build agents, docs updates
Event stream - hook logger writes to database for UI consumption

key_decisions.rationale: MVP focus - sessions managed via CLI, UI is read/observe only
Already capturing events to JSONL, just need DB bridge for UI
User wants session flows visualized with project-level grouping
A Project = a codebase/repo onboarded into the system. Sessions belong to projects. Projects have their own lifecycle status.

key_decisions.decision: Onboarding steps tracked in model for future automation
key_decisions.rationale: SDK loads skills/agents relative to cwd. Track onboarding_status JSON for steps like path_validated, claude_dir_exists, skills_linked, etc. MVP just validates path exists.

key_decisions.decision: Swimlane shows sessions as lanes with phase progression
key_decisions.rationale: Project view shows multiple sessions, each as a horizontal lane going through SPEC → PLAN → BUILD → DOCS. Click phase to drill into details (rendered spec, rendered plan, build agents, docs summary).
User preference - familiar with React ecosystem, not Vue. Next.js App Router for routing, Zustand for state management.
Keep JSONL files AND write to database. JSONL as backup, DB as source of truth for UI. Can simplify later.
Quick to build, well-documented, popular combo for React apps.

plan_state.summary: Checkpoint 4 complete - hook logger dual-write + agent events API + event timeline UI
